docTitle.titlePart: EMPLOYMENT, LABOUR AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS COMMITTEE

front.note: The European Union's External Labour Migration Policy; Rationale, Objectives, Approaches and Results,

JEL Classification:
F22, N44, K37
This paper is part of the joint project between the Directorate General for Migration and Home Affairs of the
European Commission and the OECD's Directorate for Employment, Labour and Social Affairs on " Review of
Labour Migration Policy in Europe " .

This document has been produced with the financial assistance of the European Union. The views expressed
herein can in no way be taken to reflect the official opinion of the European Union.
Grant: HOME/2013/EIFX/CA/002 / 30-CE-0615920/00-38 (DI130895)
A previous version of this paper (DELSA/ELSA/MI(2015)2) was presented and discussed at the OECD Working
Party on Migration in June 2015.

byline.affiliation:
Authorised for publication by Stefano Scarpetta, Director, Directorate for Employment, Labour and Social
Affairs, OECD.
